intro: Icacorea guadalupensis, commonly known as Guadalupe hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of Texas and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a velvety texture. Icacorea guadalupensis thrives in sandy soils and is adapted to coastal and arid environments.
